stores.name: BORED - Skateshop & Tee Emporium
stores.description: A cramped skateshop run by a kid named BORED. Walls plastered with posters, graffiti, and sticker layers from decades of mall kids. Skate decks lean against the walls. Air smells like grip tape and teenage ennui.

interior.walls: Band posters, mall graffiti tags, stickerbombed surfaces.
interior.floor: Black-painted concrete, smoothed by wear and skateboard wax.
interior.counter: Overflowing with tees, hoodie stacks, and unboxed skate parts.

owner.name: BORED
owner.personality: Underwhelmed until suddenly passionate. Knows every store secret but acts like he doesn't care.
owner.notes: Inherited the space accidentally when his dad left for Florida. Probably shouldn't have a lease but no one stopped him.

stores.name: Milo's Discount Optics
stores.description: A small optician shop. Glass displays full of frames. Eye charts on walls. Milo behind the counter, looking overqualified and tired.

interior.walls: Soft blue. Motivational posters about vision.
interior.lighting: Harsh fluorescent. Shows every dust particle.

stores.name: HARD COPY
stores.description: A dual-space anomaly. Arcade on one side - 80s cabinets glowing neon in the darkness. Through a beaded curtain, a bookstore lit like a head shop. Both sides feel open but eerily abandoned.

arcade_side.walls: Black with neon trim. Cyberpunk aesthetic.
arcade_side.floor: Carpet with geometric patterns. Cigarette burns.
arcade_side.cabinets: Pac-Man, Galaga, Asteroids, and one working Pong machine.
arcade_side.lighting: Neon glow. Pink, blue, purple. AOL dial-up era vibes.
arcade_side.sound: Electronic beeps and boops. The Pong cabinet pings softly.

bookstore_side.entrance: Beaded curtain doorway. Click-clack as you pass through.
bookstore_side.walls: Deep purple. Tapestries with occult symbols.
bookstore_side.shelves: Overstuffed with books. Occult, new age, conspiracy.
bookstore_side.lighting: Dim lamps. Head-shop aesthetic. Lava lamp in the corner.

stores.name: COMPHUT
stores.description: A Blockbuster/RadioShack abomination. Half the store is VHS tapes in plastic cases. The other half is transistors, cables, and obsolete computer parts. Semi-filled shelves. No workers anywhere.

interior.walls: Yellow and blue corporate colors, faded.
interior.shelves_left: VHS tapes. Action, comedy, horror. Be Kind Rewind.
interior.shelves_right: Cables, adapters, resistors in plastic bins.

stores.name: Wizard Bunker
stores.description: Comics and cards shop. All the comics are generic Archie and Jughead ripoff types - same plots, different names. All the cards are for sports like cricket. Just 1-2 of each are examinable. The rest is low-res detritus.

interior.walls: Posters of generic superheroes you don't recognize.
interior.displays: Longboxes of comics. Binders of cricket cards.
interior.counter: Glass case with 'rare' items. Nothing valuable.

examinable_items.name: Archfield & Jugster #47
examinable_items.description: Two teens get into wacky hijinks at a malt shop.

examinable_items.name: The Incredible Bulk #12
examinable_items.description: A scientist turns into a large green person.

examinable_items.name: Sir Donald Bradman
examinable_items.description: Cricket legend. Stats you don't understand.

examinable_items.name: Kumar Ranjitsinhji
examinable_items.description: Another cricket legend. More incomprehensible stats.

stores.name: Out-of-Service Merchandise
stores.description: The irony is not lost on anyone. A store called Out-of-Service Merchandise, selling broken and discontinued items. The meta-humor stopped being funny years ago.

interior.shelves: Display models with DEMO stickers. None work.

stores.name: Generic Store (Sign Unreadable)
stores.description: A store whose sign has faded completely. Interior mostly empty. Paper covers the windows from inside.

stores.name: Another Store (Also Unreadable)
stores.description: Shelves mostly empty. Whatever this was, it's been gutted. Dust outlines where merchandise used to be.

stores.name: The Anchor Store (Name Forgotten)
stores.description: A massive, dead department store. Mannequins stand frozen in windows. Most lights are out. Exposed ceiling grid. A lone vending machine hums in the darkness. Echoes carry strangely here. This is where retail comes to die.

interior.floor: Polished but scuffed. Tile transitions to carpet.
interior.displays: Empty. Clearance racks with nothing on them.
interior.lighting: Mostly dark. Scattered working lights. Vending machine glow.
interior.atmosphere: Eerie. Huge empty space. Cold. Your footsteps echo.

stores.name: Sunken Food Court
stores.description: Accessed by ramp. Metal framework canopies over empty counters. Striped vendor facades. Sticky tables. The slushee machine still works. Pretzel Hut never opened - COMING SOON sign has NOW CLOSED taped over it.

interior.ceiling: High. You can see the ground floor above.
interior.floor: Tile, stained with decades of fast food.

stores.name: 6-Plex Theater
stores.description: Underground cinema. Velvet ropes at the entrance. Flickering marquee. Only Screen 1 is fleshed out - rows of seats descending into darkness, sticky floors, faint glow from the screen. Screens 2-6 are dark, unused, waiting.

interior.lobby: Popcorn smell without popcorn. Movie posters for films you don't recognize.
interior.screens_2_6: Dark. Unused. Open space for future content.

stores.name: Service Corridor
stores.description: Back corridors. Utility fixtures. Vents. No customer should be here. But you can go here anyway. STAFF ONLY signs everywhere, but who's enforcing it?

interior.lighting: Harsh. All lights work here (for maintenance).
interior.sounds: Vents hum. Pipes rattle. Echoes carry weirdly.

stores.name: Restroom
stores.description: The restroom entrance. Door is jammed. You can smell chlorine and something else you don't want to think about.

stores.name: Kiosk
stores.description: A lone kiosk in the middle of the corridor. Glass display cases, empty. Used to sell phone accessories. Or sunglasses. Or both.
